column4: Don't know if people here can help with this...When I try to boot into my vista partition from grub, my computer just restarts and comes back to grub. Anyone have any ideas?
sudo fdisk -l , does that show your partitions? (just stab in the dark)
yep, theyre all there
i can see the partition just fine from here (ubuntu)
ok, my partition table got trashed by an install once, had to reinstall vista. Thats good for you. Is your vista on partition 1?
sda3
hm, a sec
sorry, I thought I had some down time at work. brb
np
while I'm finishing here, could you put your /boot/grub/menu.lst on http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/49088/
sorry, still here
np
only a couple thing i still use windows for
back for real now. Your grub looks good, has vista booted before?
yea
then I'm clueless, it's usually a problem with windows not being on the first partition (I never install it otherwise). Sorry
can i just like rename and rearrange the partitions so vista is on sda1
in gparted
not to my knowledge, no. Slart seems to know editing grub, maybe when he's done he can take a look
ok
thanks for trying
